p: The protein content in M. oleifera seeds increased during fermentation, but the amino acids lysine and methionine were in all cases the limiting amino acids (Table 2). In addition, the fatty acid profile of M. oleifera seeds significantly varied with fermentation, the polyunsaturated fatty acid increasing from 58.8% to 62.1%, the saturated from 26.8% to 28.7%, and the monounsaturated from 13.54% to 8.54% (Ijarotimi et al., 2013).
